thread.title: Savannah-Chatham school board member won't sleep at Jekyll Island retreat
thread.title_full: Savannah-Chatham school board member won't sleep at Jekyll Island retreat | savannahnow.com

author: Jenel Few
title: Savannah-Chatham school board member won't sleep at Jekyll Island retreat
text:
Photos Larry Lower By Jenel Few JEKYLL ISLAND —Savannah-Chatham school board member Larry Lower feels the school board could do its team building a whole lot cheaper.
“That’s money that we could have used for para pros or test coordinators, which we desperately need, Lower said.
He drove down for the Sunday evening code of conduct planning session, then drove home to Savannah while the rest of the board, and two board member’s boyfriends, spent the night in the $129 per night historic Jekyll Island Club Hotel. Check out the hotel's rooms here
The room price included a breakfast voucher in the resort’s beautiful wood paneled grand dining room.
Lower returned Monday morning for the staff strategic planning session carrying a senior discount size cup of McDonald’s coffee.
Return to savannahnow.com or see Tuesday’s Savannah Morning News for further details.
